comment: Great professor, hard class! To sum up the course, it's just a bunch of pink & purple images you have to be able to identify what it is, what it does, & identify morphological features. Don't even bother using AI for this course, bc AI doesn't know either. 3 exams, lowest replaced w final. 15 quizzes in-class, 5 dropped. Labs just attendance grade
i would not recommend taking him

Dr. B is amazing! His lectures are very straightforward and informative. Homework questions come directly from the textbook and test questions come directly from his powerpoints. The quizzes are difficult but they help prepare you for the tests. Going to lecture is a MUST he gives a lot of good info to help with quizzes and tests!
Bryanstev comes off intimidating at first, however is very kind and knowledgeable. Not showing up to lectures will definitely effect your test grade, but everything comes from lectures.
Dr. Bryanstev is a really good professor. He is clear in what he expects from you and he is always willing to answer any questions and help you out with concepts. Would take him again

Gives HW (graded for completion) and 15 min quizzes (5 questions for accuracy) every week and theyre all open note. Final is optional and replaces lowest grade. Dont treat this as an open note class and youll do fine

The rudest professor Ive ever taken. I beg you, do not take this professor. Told me no offense, but you are a very insufficient student. Says hes open to questions but is not open to what you have to say. You can provide him with trusted sources including the textbook disproving him and will say thats not what I said in lecture though.

Exam heavy but unfortunately if you wanna ask questions DONT. He will just tell you that you should have paid attention the first time and continue to be rude. Has no respect for his students and doesnt care about your grade.
Do not take him and escape now. He may seem nice during the first lecture but is very rude. Never been more disrespected as a student.

He was nice at the beginning of the semester, but definitely got more rude as time went by. Once in lab he literally snapped in my face like I was a dog to get my attention instead of addressing me like a human being. Tests are open note. Lab was time consuming but helpful. If you dont mind rude and condescending behavior I guess I recommend ����

Avoid at all costs. Worst professor at kennesaw. Extremely rude and condescending. Has no manners and chooses favorites and ignores the rest. Horrible at lecturing, you will have to teach yourself everything. Awful experience. Would never recommend him to anyone

Tests can be intimidating at first, but because they are open-note it can become easy after you get the hang of the class. Bryantsev will go above and beyond to help you, IF you seek help from him. Easy class, easy lab. Definitely would take it again if I could.

Lecture and Powerpoints were straightforward. Quizzes every week over week's material. Lab was looking at microscope slides and drawing. Lab lasted much longer than it needed to be. There was never enough microscope slides, so there was a lot of waiting around. Lab check out was too long. Open note tests, quizzes, and practical.

Bryantsev can seem intimidating, but hes a pretty cool guy. I had no problem with him. Histology is very interesting but covers a lot of material. He definitely prepares you for exams and quizzes and they are all open note but you still must study and prepare. Lab is simple. Drawing tissues. With good drawings youll ace the final. Got a high B
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Took Bryantsev for Histology, the class has 4 exams with an optional lecture final, labs were once a week, points for attendance and one lab final. A short quiz is taken every Friday and he includes your best 15 (drops 5). Pretty straightforward material, you just need to study the powerpoints he puts online, and he allowed open notes.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Clear grading criteria

comment: I took him for Genetics lab. All of the tests and quizzes were open note and overall it was a pretty easy class.

I took him for seminar. We had to write a three page opinion paper. He sent everyone their paper back saying they weren't sufficient and we would all fail. This class is pass fail and one credit hour and he was impossible. No grading criteria. Absolute worst professor.

He drops your lowest test score, and he gave one group extra credit for having good lab results which was mainly due to luck. Easy A ,however the instructions from professor is very confusing which led me to miss one exam. He has only one lab report and I skipped it as I assumed I had an A. Made B even after I missed 2 graded stuff.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Dr. Bryantsev is very knowledgeable. His test are open note, which is a blessing for Molecular Genetics. However, they are not easy. He's a bit disorganized, which can make preparing for tests and labs difficult. He does genuinely care and while he may come across as mean, he means well. Overall, he's a good professor and I did learn from him.

When the semester began, he seemed like an awesome lab teacher, but after time went on he became condescending and extremely rude. Although the test are online an open notes, they are so confusing that it makes it hard to understand them. The test are supposed to be on the labs, but most of the questions have nothing to do with the lab. DON'T DO IT
